description: Standardize all Papertrail validators as Python library modules (not CLI tools). Create unified validator framework used internally by coderef-docs and coderef-workflow MCP servers. Eliminate PowerShell scripts, consolidate validation logic into papertrail Python package.
goal: Convert validator scripts into reusable Python library modules that MCP servers import directly. Single Python package with consistent validation API.
requirements: Keep validators/scripts/validate.py and validators/plans/validate.py as-is (already Python)
All validators return ValidationResult objects (consistent with papertrail.validator)
Maintain all validation rules from PowerShell versions
out_of_scope: CLI interfaces or argparse (internal library only)
Standalone validator scripts (validators/ becomes internal only)
User-facing documentation (internal API for MCP servers)
constraints: Must integrate with existing papertrail.validator.UDSValidator base class
Must use existing schemas in schemas/ directory
No breaking changes to JSON schemas
Validators consumed by coderef-docs and coderef-workflow via Python imports only
